hypotheses.H1: The texture features from rose leaves can be used for accurate classification of rose species.
hypotheses.H2: Random Forest model can be optimized to outperform other machine learning models like Naive Bayes, Generalized Linear Models, Decision Trees, etc.
hypotheses.H3: Ensemble learning methods by using various combinations of machine learning classifiers produce higher accuracy in rose plant classification.
hypotheses.H4: Machine learning models have different performance when different feature sets are used, with some combinations yielding higher accuracies.
hypotheses.H5: Optimizing Random Forest parameters (number of trees and depth of trees) will improve its classification accuracy notably over default settings.

additional_details.context: The study focuses on using texture and histogram features from rose plant leaves to classify rose species using several machine learning models.

performance_evaluation.comparison: Impact of feature sets and algorithm combinations on classification accuracy
